standard_metadata.standard_description: Explain why a fraction a/b is equivalent to a fraction (n × a)/(n × b) by using visual fraction models, with attention to how the number and size of the parts differ even though the two fractions themselves are the same size. Use this principle to recognize and generate equivalent fractions.

question.content: **Use the number line below to help you complete the equation.**    $\dfrac14=\dfrac{p}{12}$  $p=$

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 1 with tick marks every one-twelfth unit. A point labeled one-fourth appears at the third tick mark after 0.

hints.content: Numbers are equivalent when they are located at the same point on the number line.
[[☃ image 1]]  $\dfrac14$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\greenD{\dfrac3{12}}$.

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 1 with labeled tick marks every one-twelfth unit. A point at tick mark three-twelfths is labeled one-fourth.

hints.content: $\dfrac14=\greenD{\dfrac3{12}}$  $p=\greenD3$

question.content: **Use the number line below to help you complete the equation.**      $\dfrac{r}{5}=\dfrac8{10}$  $r=$

images.alt: A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, an unlabeled tick mark, a tick mark labeled one-fifth, five unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark with a point labeled eight-tenths, one unlabeled tick mark, and an ending tick mark at 1.

hints.content: Numbers are equivalent when they are located at the same point on the number line.
[[☃ image 1]]  $\dfrac8{10}$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\greenD{\dfrac45}$.

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 1 with major tick marks every one-fifth unit and unlabeled minor tick marks between each major tick mark. A point labeled eight-tenths appears at tick mark four-fifths.

hints.content: $\greenD{\dfrac45}=\dfrac8{10}$  $r=\greenD4$

question.content: **Use the number line below to help you complete the equation.**    $\dfrac32=\dfrac{z}{4}$  $z=$

images.alt: A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, a tick mark labeled one-fourth, two unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 1, an unlabeled tick mark, a tick mark with a point labeled three-halves, an unlabeled tick mark, and an ending tick mark at 2.

hints.content: Numbers are equivalent when they are located at the same point on the number line.
[[☃ image 1]]  $\dfrac32$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\greenD{\dfrac64}$.

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 2 with tick marks every one-fourth unit. A point labeled three-halves appears at tick mark six-fourths.

hints.content: $\dfrac32=\greenD{\dfrac64}$  $z=\greenD6$

question.content: **Use the number line below to help you complete the equation.**    $\dfrac{t}{6}=\dfrac{4}{3}$  $t=$

images.alt: An equally spaced number line from 0 to 2, with the point eight tick marks away from 0 labeled 4 thirds and the point 1 tick mark away from 0 labeled 1 sixth.

hints.content: Numbers are equivalent when they are located at the same point on the number line.
$\dfrac43$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\greenD{\dfrac86}$.

images.alt: The same number line incremented by sixths and with the point labeled 4 thirds at the same spot as the point labeled 8 sixths.

hints.content: $\greenD{\dfrac86}=\dfrac43$  $t=\greenD8$

question.content: **Use the number line below to help you complete the equation.**     $\dfrac{x}{8}=\dfrac55$  $x=$

images.alt: A number line with a starting tick mark at 0, a tick mark labeled one-eighth, six unlabeled tick marks, and a point labeled five-fifths at the ending tick mark 1.

hints.content: Numbers are equivalent when they are located at the same point on the number line.
[[☃ image 1]]  $\dfrac55$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\greenD{\dfrac88}$.

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to eight-eighths with tick marks every one-eighth unit. A point labeled five-fifths appears at tick mark eight-eighths.

hints.content: $\greenD{\dfrac88}=\dfrac55$  $x=\greenD8$

question.content: **Move the dot to a fraction equivalent to $\dfrac53$ on each number line.**       **Complete the equation.**  $\dfrac{5}{3} = \dfrac{t}{6}$  $t=$

hints.content: First, let's graph $\maroonD{\dfrac53}$.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-thirds to six-thirds with tick marks every one-third unit. A point appears at tick mark five-thirds.

hints.content: Numbers are equivalent when they are located at the same point on the number line.
$\maroonD{\dfrac{10}6}$ is at the same location as $\maroonD{\dfrac53}$  on the number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonD{\dfrac{10}{6}}=\maroonD{\dfrac53}$

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-thirds to six-thirds with major tick marks every one-third unit and minor tick marks between the major tick marks. Above the number line tick mark zero-thirds is labeled zero-sixths, tick mark one-third is labeled two-sixths, tick mark two-thirds is labeled four-sixths, tick mark three-thirds is labeled six-sixths, tick mark four-thirds is labeled eight-sixths, tick mark five-thirds is labeled ten-sixths, and tick mark six-thirds is labeled twelve-sixths. A point appears at tick mark five-thirds which is also labeled ten-sixths.

hints.content: The number lines should be graphed as follows:     [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]    $\dfrac{5}{3} = \dfrac{\maroonD{10}}{6}$

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-thirds to six-thirds with unlabeled tick marks every one-third unit. A point appears five tick marks to the right of zero-thirds.
A number line labeled zero-sixths to twelve-sixths with unlabeled tick marks every one-sixth unit. A point appears ten tick marks to the right of tick mark zero-sixths.

question.content: **Move the dot to a fraction equivalent to $\dfrac25$ on each number line.**       **Complete the equation.**  $ \dfrac{y}{10}=\dfrac{2}{5}$  $y=$

hints.content: First, let's graph $\maroonD{\dfrac25}$.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-fifths to five-fifths with tick marks every one-fifth unit. A point appears at tick mark two-fifths.

hints.content: Numbers are equivalent when they are located at the same point on the number line.
$\maroonD{\dfrac4{10}}$ is the at the same location as $\maroonD{\dfrac25}$  on the number line.   [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonD{\dfrac4{10}}=\maroonD{\dfrac25}$

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-fifths to five-fifths with major tick marks every one-fifth unit and minor tick marks between the major tick marks. Above the number line, tick mark zero-fifths is labeled zero-tenths, tick mark one-fifth is labeled two-tenths, tick mark two-fifths is labeled four-tenths, tick mark three-fifths is labeled six-tenths, tick mark four-fifths is labeled eight-tenths, and five-tenths is labeled ten-tenths. A point appears at tick mark two-tenths which is also labeled four-tenths.

hints.content: The number lines should be graphed as follows:     [[☃ image 1]]    [[☃ image 2]]    $\dfrac{\maroonD{4}}{10}=\dfrac{2}{5}$

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-fifths to five-fifths with unlabeled tick marks every one-fifth unit. A point appears two tick marks to the right of tick mark zero-fifths.
A number line labeled zero-tenths to ten-tenths with unlabeled tick marks every one-tenth unit. A point appears four tick marks to the right of tick mark zero-tenths.

Above the number line, tick mark zero-fourths is labeled zero-eighths, tick mark one-fourth is labeled two-eighths, tick mark two-fourths is labeled four-eighths, tick mark three-fourths is labeled six-eighths, tick mark four-fourths is labeled eight-eighths, tick mark five-fourths is labeled ten-eights, and tick mark six-fourths is labeled twelve-eighths. A number line labeled zero-eighths to twelve-eighths with unlabeled tick marks every one-eighth unit. A point appears eight tick marks to the right of tick mark zero-eighths.

hints.content: First, let's graph $\maroonD{\dfrac96}$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-sixths to twelve-sixths with tick marks at every one-sixth unit. A yellow point appears at the nine-sixths tick mark.

hints.content: Numbers are equivalent when they are located at the same point on the number line.
$\maroonD{\dfrac32}$ is the at the same location as $\maroonD{\dfrac96}$  on the number line.  [[☃ image 1]]    $\maroonD{\dfrac32}=\maroonD{\dfrac96}$

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-sixths to twelve-sixths with tick marks at every one-sixth unit. A yellow point appears at the nine-sixths tick mark. Above the number line, the tick mark at zero-sixths is labeled zero-halves, the tick mark at three-sixths is labeled one-half, the tick mark at six-sixths is labeled two-halves, the tick mark at nine-sixths is labeled three-halves, and the tick mark at twelve-sixths is labeled four-halves.

hints.content: The number lines should be graphed as follows:     [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]    $\dfrac{\maroonD{3}}{2}=\dfrac{9}{6}$

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-sixths to twelve-sixths with tick marks at every one-sixth unit. A yellow point appears nine ticks marks to the right of the zero-sixths tick mark.

A number line the same length as the number line above that has, moving from left to right, a starting tick mark at zero-halves, two unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled with a yellow dot, and an ending tick mark at four-halves.

question.content: **Move the dot to a fraction equivalent to $\dfrac9{12}$ on each number line.**        **Complete the equation.**  $\dfrac{9}{12} = \dfrac{f}{4}$  $f=$

hints.content: First, let's graph $\maroonD{\dfrac9{12}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-twelfths to twelve-twelfths with tick marks every one-twelfth unit. A point appears at tick mark nine-twelfths.

$\maroonD{\dfrac34}$ is the at the same location as $\maroonD{\dfrac9{12}}$  on the number line.   [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonD{\dfrac34}=\maroonD{\dfrac9{12}}$

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-twelfths to twelve-twelfths with tick marks every one-twelfth unit. Above the number line tick mark zero-twelfths is labeled zero-fourths, tick mark three-twelfths is labeled one-fourth, tick mark six-twelfths is labeled two-fourths, tick mark nine-twelfths is labeled three-fourths, and tick mark twelve-twelfths is labeled four-fourths. A number line labeled zero-fourths to four-fourths with unlabeled tick marks every one-fourth unit. A point appears three tick marks to the right of zero-fourths.
A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, five unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at point A, one unlabeled tick mark, and an ending tick mark at 1.

hints.content: First, let's identify the point on the number line.    [[☃ image 1]]  Point $\blueD{A}$ is located at $\dfrac{6}{8}$.

hints.content: Numbers are equivalent when they are located at the same point on the number line.
[[☃ image 1]]   $\blueD{\dfrac{3}{4}}$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\blueD{\dfrac{6}{8}}$.

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-eighths to eight-eighths with tick marks at every one-eighth unit. Above the number line, the tick mark at zero-eighths is labeled zero-fourths, the tick mark at two-eighths is labeled one-fourth, the tick mark at four-eighths is labeled two-fourths, the tick mark at six-eighths is labeled three-fourths, and the tick mark at eight-eighths is labeled four-fourths. There is a blue point at the six-eighths tick mark, which is also labeled three-fourths.

hints.content: Point $\blueD{A}$ is located at $\dfrac{3}{4}$.

Above the number line, the tick mark at zero-eighths is labeled zero-fourths, the tick mark at two-eighths is labeled one-fourth, the tick mark at four-eighths is labeled two-fourths, the tick mark at six-eighths is labeled three-fourths, the tick mark at eight-eighths is labeled four-fourths, the tick mark at ten-eighths is labeled five-fourths, and the tick mark at twelve-eighths is labeled six-fourths. Above the number line, the tick mark at zero is labeled zero-eighths, the tick mark at one-half is labeled four-eighths, the tick mark at one is labeled eight-eighths, the tick mark at three-halves is labeled twelve-eighths.
